channel.title: MoreLinq – So many manuals, so little time
channel.description: So many manuals, so little time

item.title: Distinct on multiple properties in a collection
item.dc:creator: ajitgoel
item.description:
Problem: How do I get distinct members of a collection, based on multiple properties? Solution: Use MoreLinq to get distinct members of a collection, based on multiple properties. eg: For our application, each member in the household was supposed to have a unique combination of driver’s licence number and driver’s state.

The post Distinct on multiple properties in a collection appeared first on So many manuals, so little time.
item.content:encoded:
Problem:
How do I get distinct members of a collection, based on multiple properties?

Solution:
Use MoreLinq to get distinct members of a collection, based on multiple properties.
eg: For our application, each member in the household was supposed to have a unique combination of driver’s licence number and driver’s state. 

 
var query = household.DistinctBy(
            counter => new { counter.DriverLicenceNumber, counter.DriverLicenceState });

The post Distinct on multiple properties in a collection appeared first on So many manuals, so little time.
